pros:
They try to do there best to follow all employment standard and best practices when it comes to managing a hospital. Professional staff on most off the departments and great employee perks. Such as Goodlife, Rogers, CAA, and insurance at corporate rates. A great sense off community exists within the organization. People are recognized for standing out and going beyond the call off duty. Special events and interesting learning opportunities always available online or on site.
A workout area (getaway room) is available to staff for working out and maintaining a healthy life balance, free off charge and at all three facilities of North York General.
cons:
- Parking rates for employees.
- Some disgruntled staff can make your already busy day even worse with negative comments. Though, im sure that exists everywhere.
- Favoritism of certain staff over others.

review_title: not a good place to work

pros: None that comes to mind.
cons: I worked in the OR department as a unit secretary and experienced workplace bullying from colleagues and management. It was a bad decision on my part to accept this job considering I was hired on the spot the same day. I now realize there was a lot of turnover going on due to the systemic toxic work environment. It appears many of the OR staff  have worked together for years creating an inbred culture,  if you don't behave and act like them then you're life is made a living hell. The union was pointless they did nothing to help my situation.

review_title: Do not work here if you are studying.
pros:
- Provides good learning environment for new hires (nurses)
- Full Electronic Charting for Nurses/Physicians
- Dedicated & helpful Clinical Nurse Educators (CNE)
- Nice staff and coworkers
cons:
- Highly political (Managers)
- Staff are overworked (Part-time contract but gets full time hours [always the case])
- Management does not listen unless something wrong happens
- Shady payroll style (Using pen and paper when marking if you worked or not)
- Management highly discourage people who like to advance (e.g., if you are studying, they deem it as a threat for staffing & schedule you anyway).
